Our roborios Ethernet port pins got out of their slots

We are scared of breaking the pins if we force them down

Does anyone has exp with this any suggestions about what we can do

If you start a topic here, they will provide support. Just be aware that if a replacement device has to be shipped, Turkish customs can cause long delays.
https://forums.ni.com/t5/Troubleshooting-Hardware/bd-p/TroubleshootingHardware buradan konu açarsanız dönüş yaparlar. Biz kırılan usb soketimiz için buraya konu açıp destek almıştık ama aklınızda olsun gümrükten dolayı yeni cihaz gelirse uzun sürebiliyor.

Our teams Roborio ethernet pins get out from Their slot what should we do

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-09-20T13:06:51.242Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":100.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":506454,"topic_slug":"robo-rio-ethernet-socket-proplem","display_username":"Eray","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69199,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robo-rio-ethernet-socket-proplem/506454/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3743586,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-20T14:09:20.543Z","cooked":"

It’s worth reaching out to NI, though I found them less than helpful in our case (which was a trapped-like-Excalibur USB cable). Others have reported receiving more help than we got.

In your case, if NI is unhelpful or if you can’t wait, I wouldn’t hesitate to take the cover off and replace the Ethernet jack. There is a very common footprint for it and you will very likely to be able to find a matching part. LCSC shows 41 different “shielded, through hole, RJ45, vertical” jacks. Most appear to have the common footprint, meaning you’re pretty likely to find a workable replacement part.

Find someone local who has done some part replacements and this one won’t be difficult.

I took the cover off a Rio1 I have here and it looks like it’s the most common footprint for an LED through-hole RJ45 (and there’s a LOAD of space around the port on the board, so you should have a fairly easy time of it for someone with modest experience at desoldering).

IMG_28181576×2100 258 KB

Edit to add: I don’t know what parts vendors are near you, but something like this will probably work: R-RJ45S08P-C000 | Ckmtw | Price | In Stock | LCSC Electronics

(You have more incentive than I do to take very careful measurements and find the exact right part, of course. )

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-09-20T14:13:48.285Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":91.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":506454,"topic_slug":"robo-rio-ethernet-socket-proplem","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.lcsc.com/product-detail/C386764.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"R-RJ45S08P-C000 | Ckmtw | Price | In Stock | LCSC Electronics","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/robo-rio-ethernet-socket-proplem/506454/6","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3743587,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-20T14:10:10.700Z","cooked":"

One of our roboRIO’s Ethernet port failed (for other reasons) out of warranty so we use an Ethernet to USB adapter.

If you aren’t going to have someone repair the roboRIO, then you have nothing to lose so try to push the pins back where they belong. That is tricky and we’ve even had commercial Ethernet cables that couldn’t get all the springs at the same level so we had to throw away the cables.

Note that not all the pins are used so maybe you get lucky there.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-09-20T14:10:10.700Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":60.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":506454,"topic_slug":"robo-rio-ethernet-socket-proplem","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69199,"username":"Husderay","name":"Eray","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/husderay/{size}/264632_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robo-rio-ethernet-socket-proplem/506454/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3743590,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-20T14:26:57.218Z","cooked":"
SLAB-Mr.Thomas:

Note that not all the pins are used so maybe you get lucky there.

That’s a good point and I think you’re in luck here. The damaged pins are pins 7&8, which are not used in 100Mbps ethernet, so you can potentially just cut them off (to prevent them sticking the plug or shorting out pin 6).

I’d still start with NI, and if that fails, decide your own pros & cons of cutting and YOLOing it or cutting and testing, with a fallback of replacing the port.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-09-20T14:26:57.218Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":102,"readers_count":101,"score":70.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506454,"topic_slug":"robo-rio-ethernet-socket-proplem","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/robo-rio-ethernet-socket-proplem/506454/8","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3744630,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-22T01:16:59.184Z","cooked":"

As others said, it’s worth reaching out to NI because why not. But I’m pretty sure the nearest NI repair center is somewhere in Europe (I want to say Romania but not sure if I’m remembering that right). So it’s probably not the easiest thing to send it in for repair.

You may be better off getting someone local with soldering experience to replace the port. That would void any warranty you might have, but if you’re going that route then it probably doesn’t matter to you.
